# Canadian Port Waste Facilities Case Studies

## Description of the Opportunity

Transport Canada is seeking a consultant to support plastic waste reduction and assess the reception capacity of solid and liquid waste in Canada through the identification of gaps, challenges, best practices, and opportunities to improve waste management at Canadian ports. The project will comprise of case studies of minimum six (6) select ports (East Coast, West Coast, Great Lakes).

### Objectives

1.  Identify gaps and challenges in waste management practices at Canadian ports
2.  Develop baseline data on the amount of waste (plastic and liquid) being produced and offloaded by ships at ports
3.  Analyze the interaction between calling vessels and port authorities
4.  Determine how waste, including international waste, is handled by the port, tracked as it leaves the port, and where it inevitably ends up
5.  Identify waste management practices and capacity at local municipalities where the ports are situated
